intro: Maesobotrya villosa var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy maesobotrya, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
